intro: Distyliopsis yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan distyliopsis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound umbel inflorescence. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has slender, hairy stems. Its small white or greenish flowers are accompanied by finely divided leaves, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
